    DevOps Engineer
    Company Name Headspace Inc. Company Location San Francisco, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    About The DevOps Engineer At Headspace

    We are searching for a DevOps Engineer to join our team. This role will provide support for the Developers, Big Data, QA and Product teams and will focus heavily on automation, monitoring and scaling the infrastructure.

    How your skills and passion will come to life at Headspace:

    • Build and maintain Production, Development and QA environments
    • Improve performance and scalability of existing systems
    • Monitor and troubleshoot server related issues
    • Develop and document best practices for disaster recovery and application deployment
    • Perform penetration testing to ensure security of our infrastructure
    • Research and develop new technologies for improving existing systems
    • Participate in on-call rotation

    What You’ve Accomplished

    • BS/MS degree in Computer Science or 4-8 years related experience
    • Solid experience with Linux (Ubuntu, CentOS) administration
    • Ability to work effectively within a team and autonomously with minimal supervision
    • AWS (EC2, VPC, S3, RDS, IAM, ElastiCache, Redshift, Elastic MapReduce, Route 53)
    • Experience with Apache, Nginx, HAProxy, MySQL, Redis
    • Shell programming experience with Bash and experience with at least one of Perl, Python, Ruby
    • Experience with server monitoring with Nagios (and derivatives) and/or Prometheus
    • Server automation with Terraform and Ansible/Puppet or other configuration management tools
    • Database administration experience
    • Experience with Git

    How To Get Started

    If you’re excited by the idea of seeing yourself in this role at Headspace, please apply with your CV and a cover letter that best expresses your interest and unique qualifications.


    Backend Engineer
    Company Name Booster Fuels Company Location Burlingame, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    At Booster, we’re reinventing the way your car gets gas. Our platform is the heart that makes sure the right data flows to the right clients, from receiving customer orders to dispatching tankers to fulfill those orders to tracking how much gas we pumped. As a Junior Backend Engineer, you’ll work closely with our Marketing, Growth, and Customer Success teams to manage our analytics integrations and automate our common support tasks.

    Requirements

    Possible projects include:

    • Automating reminder notifications to help improve customer retention
    • Integrating new backend workflows with analytics tools like Segment
    • Creating a backend interface for toggling which push notifications a customer is eligible for
    • Automated SMS interactions for common customer issues
    • Automated push notifications to our driver app when important changes happen

    Responsibilities Include

    • Design and implement new backend features ranging from tools to help operations run efficiently to integrations with growth marketing tools
    • Own our internal slack notifications and Segment integrations
    • Work with marketing to maintain and improve consumer-facing push notifications

    Ideal Candidate Has

    • 2 years of experience working with Node.js and/or MongoDB
    • Built several REST-ful APIs
    • A solid knowledge of JavaScript
    • Experience with one or more analytics tools (Segment, Google Analytics, KeenIO, Mixpanel, etc.)
    • Clear communication and a willingness to work in cross-functional teams

    Benefits

    What Is In It For You

    • Be early: one of our first 10 engineers addressing a $trillion-dollar market
    • Solve a pain point that everyone feels...every week in the real world.
    • A “full-stack” team experience -- opportunity to wear many hats
    • Customers that share their love for our product every day
    • Free rides around town in our purple tonka trucks, driven by the best drivers on Earth
    • A team of seasoned professionals united in our mission and in honing each others’ skills.
    • A culture that thrives on individual impact and advancement in rapid growth; AND
    • Medical, Vision and Dental insurance
    • Gas available at cost
    • Paid Vacation/Sick Time
    • Early stage startup environment
    • Equity in Booster
    • Work directly with the founders

      • Booster Fuels, is committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or any other protected status with respect to recruitment, hiring, promotion and other terms and conditions of employment. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed

    Dev Ops Engineer
    Company Name ATCSEARCH Company Location San Francisco Bay Area
    Job Link

    Job description

    Sr.Software Engineer (QA-Cloud DevOps)

    This is a ground floor opportunity with a big data security analytics with a substantially funded, fast growing start up that enables enterprises to defend against sophisticated cyber threats.

    You will participate in building a breakthrough AI/Machine Learning based platform, that can ingest, model and analyze massive flow of machine generated security data. You will help build the next-generation infrastructure and security platform, which includes an application and service delivery platform, massively scalable distributed data storage and replication systems, and a cutting-edge search and behavior visualization system.

    As Sr.QA & Cloud DevOps engineer you will automate existing test cases, and work on developing automation test suites and other CloudOps tools for cloud deployments.

    You will own end-to-end test deliverables for product services, features and components, and integrate the automation test suite with continuous integration (CI) systems, such as Jenkins.

    You will also help teams in setting up test environments, servers to reproduce and fix issues.

    You will running sanity, regression, performance and security test suites on a regular basis, and logging issues, in addition to planning, researching, recommending, and using new technologies as required.

    This position requires effective communication and collaboration with the rest of the Quality Engineering, research, and development teams.

    To Succeed You Must Have:

    • 7 or more years of Quality Engineering and Cloud DevOps experience with automated testing of big data and/or analytics systems
    • Experience developing software or test automation in Python and Selenium
    • Experience using tools such as Hadoop, Spark, Scala, HDFS, Solr / ElasticSearch and Impala.
    • Strong verbal and written communication skills
    • Strong technical knowledge of Microservices and decoupled systems architecture.
    • Cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure)
    • Provisioning and configuration management tools (Kubernetes/Docker/Puppet/Ansible/Chef)

    Strong understanding of Python and Linux operating system

    Network administration (Routing, Firewalls, DNS, TCP/IP)

    Must be able to work with agile methodology in a fast-paced environment.

    Must be an excellent problem-solver and quick learner, and possess analytical skills

    Experience testing scalable, distributed big data systems.

    Working knowledge of bug tracking tools (e.g., Atlassian Jira) have Amazon EC2 and AWS skills

    Having security background is a big plus.

    Strong verbal, and written communication skills.

Date: Oct 26, 2017 Location: San Ramon, CA, IN, 94583 Company: SAP Position Description & Responsibilities As an experienced z/OS Assembler developer, you understand the importance of the mainframe in the world today. The ideal candidate will become a member of a team working on industry leading data movement software products used by companies around the world. Using agile development, you will help deliver software that will supply SAP HANA with data from mainframe sources like DB2 and legacy CICS/COBOL Position Description & Responsibilities As an experienced z/OS Assembler developer, you understand the importance of the mainframe in the world today. The ideal candidate will become a member of a team working on industry leading data movement software products used by companies around the world. Using agile development, you will help deliver software that will supply SAP HANA with data from mainframe sources like DB2 and legacy CICS/COBOL Primary Roles/Responsibilities: Create or augment new or existing technical specifications, clearly defining the programming effort required for new and changing programs, and interfaces to existing products Provide estimates for the programming effort defined in the technical specifications Identify potential roadblocks and develop around them Develop code that matches the prototype and specification, is maintainable and, as necessary, portable to other environments Perform problem determination for production release and create source code changes to provide solutions Complete implementation within time estimates Assist Technical Writer in developing technical documentation, and review materials for technical accuracy Mentor other Developers, Support or Quality Assurance in understanding product architecture, new functionality, and in identifying strategies for problem resolution Occasionally contact customers to understand problems or to provide a technical explanation Perform other duties as required Plan the implementation of new products and enhancements as reflected by the architecture Qualifications Required Skills/Competencies: Proficient in z/OS Assembler and C programming languages In-depth knowledge of z/OS internals and operating system component internals. Solid understanding of how to utilize system user exits and other system extension techniques Significant knowledge of and practical experience with z/OS programming languages and software development techniques Significant knowledge in CICS and MQ Series environments Sufficient knowledge of TCP/IP C/C++ or JAVA with databases knowledge as desired skills along with mainframe knowledge as the requirement is to design/implement/maintain adapter which will be implemented in C/C++ or JAVA so have database and systems knowledge is desirable. Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills using system dumps Self-motivated / takes initiative Ability to meet deadlines Ability to write code that is maintainable, extendible and has minimal bugs Ability to understand requirements and ask appropriate questions for clarification, as necessary Ability to analyze marketing requirements and external prototypes and to identify design and implementation alternatives Ability to understand and adhere to the project goal without necessarily agreeing with it Agile development experience and/or knowledge is preferred. #SAPHANAcareers SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees.     DevOps Engineer, Developer Tools
    Company Name Palantir Technologies Company Location Palo Alto, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    A World-Changing Company

    At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.

    The Role

    The Developer Tools Team is a team of 5, responsible for the toolchain used by Palantir developers, from CI pipelines to self-service container schedulers and custom internal applications. Put another way, we engineer tools for the engineers.

    With 1500 people writing code in Java, Typescript, and Go all over the world, and more than 30,000 builds per week across 10,000 repositories, improvements we make for developers have huge effects. We are looking for a Dev Ops Engineer who is interested in advocating for developers and asking “what does world-class look like?” to join us in making development at Palantir better.

    Recent Projects We've Worked On Include

    • A service that automatically opens pull requests to upgrade dependency versions, standardize Gradle plugins, and correct other anti-patterns.
    • A rewrite of our documentation hosting service to add search, make it highly-available, and closely integrate it with our CI pipeline.

    In This Role, You Will

    • Deploy, improve, and maintain highly available, scalable, and monitored systems and services.
    • Identify gaps in development tools and frameworks for languages such as Java, TypeScript, and Go.
    • Manage the adoption of tools and industry best practices among development teams.
    • Research, evaluate, and develop new applications, primarily in Go.
    • Identify and automate common tasks that slow down development.

    What We Value

    • B.S./M.S. in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, Math, Physics, or equivalent experience.
    • Proficiency in a language such as Java, Python, or Go, and its corresponding build tool.
    • Experience working with AWS or another cloud provider.
    • Experience managing and developing highly-available and distributed software.
    • Exposure to infrastructure-as-code frameworks like Terraform and CloudFormation.

    Palantir is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Please see the United States Department of Labor's EEO poster and EEO poster supplement for additional information.

    If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@palantir.com or you may call us at (650) 473-9158.



    iOS Engineer, Payment Terminal
    Company Name Square Company Location San Francisco Bay Area
    Job Link

    Job description

    Payments is Square’s core product, and the majority of payments happen in our Terminal product. The Payment Terminal product team focuses on the core payment functionality in the POS app. We take our sellers’ experience as a whole and strive to improve their whole lifecycle as a business:

    What we build:

    • In-app onboarding flows, which allows new sellers to onboard to Square within the app and start taking payments very quickly.

    • Payment tutorials, which helps new sellers learn about taking payments using Square app.

    • Card-on-File, which enables sellers to save buyer’s card and charge recurrently.

    • Universal linking support, which allows marketing campaigns to directly link into features within the app, for better conversion.

    The product spans across web, iOS, and Android and our features sit atop a service oriented architecture. You’ll be working in a full stack environment from the customer facing features to the underlying services. We are hoping you will take Terminal to the next level.

    You will:

    • Design and build customer experiences in iOS

    • Help shape the direction of our next-gen app architecture

    • Build extensive, reliable support for product data logging and metrics

    • Work closely with our product, engineering, analytics, and marketing teams

    Desired Skills and Experience

    You have:

    • BA/BS degree or equivalent practical, working experience (4+ years preferred)

    • Been self-driven, open to collaboration and willing to grow as an engineer

    • A strong sense of customer empathy and desire to influence the product direction

    • Curiosity in numbers and metrics with a focus on measurable impact

    Even better if you are experienced in:

    • iOS App Development (Objective C or Swift)

    • Tech lead experience (of 3-5 persons team or more)

    • SoA Architecture

    • Database schema design

    • Cross-team and cross-functional collaboration

    Technologies we use and teach:

    • Java, Javascript, Ember.js, MySQL, Protobuf, Ruby on Rails

    • A/B test techniques and methodologies

    • iOS or Android development

    Additional Information

    At Square, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

    Description

    We are looking for an experienced DevOps engineer (5­7 Years’ experience) with a focus on AWS and automation to join our team in San Jose.     Backend Engineer
    Company Name Honor Company Location San Francisco, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Honor’s mission in life is big, really big. We want to change the world, and not in a small way. We want to make sure our parents, your parents, and everyone’s parents can age at home with joy, comfort, and grace. Home care hasn’t innovated in 30 years, here’s your chance to change that. We’re looking for passionate back-end developers to join our engineering team. Your work will directly impact the lives of people receiving care, people delivering care, and the families that are normally left in the dark about the entire care process. We want you to light up and innovate on systems that have traditionally been left behind. The product team is small, lean, and fast so if you thrive on getting your coding fingers in a lot of important pies, Honor could be the place for you.

    Are you a fit?

    • We’re looking for strong team players with team experience, people who can work with a very diverse team (engineers, care operations, sales folks, puppies).
    • You’ll need to have good computer science fundamentals, meaning you’ve got a degree in CS or something equivalent.
    • We’d love it if you had at least 3-5 years of industry experience (we’re super fast paced and will need you to hit the ground running).
    • You’re a pro at Python, or really enjoy using it.
    • You like being thrown in the middle of mission critical projects.
    • You absolutely love to learn from your peers.
    Bonus Points!

    • You <3 debugging.
    • You’ve dabbled in AWS, Thrift, and/or Docker
    Honor is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, political affiliation or belief.

    The BOOM seeks to provide resources to a disadvantaged community

    • We deliver our activities in the heart of the most troubled neighborhoods, often in backyards.

    Human Factor Engineer
    Company Name Think Surgical Company Location Fremont, California
    Job Link

    Job description

    Job Summary:

    The Human Factors Engineer works closely with SW/HW engineers, clinical trainers, and product managers to inform and guide development of THINK Surgical products, and to ensure the products are safe and effective for use. As part of product development projects, the Human Factors Engineer conducts user research, analyzes, and characterizes use-related risks, and conducts usability testing of products. This individual has primary responsibility for creating task analyses; usability risk analyses, conducting formative and summative evaluation studies, and ensuring usability engineering files are complete and accurate for approval by medical device regulatory agencies.

    Travel Requirements:

    This position may involve travel less than 20% of the time.

    Job Responsibilities:

    • Create and establish best practices and standards to drive human factors and usability engineering discipline for development projects, including:

    o Usability specifications, task analyses, usability risk analyses, and UI evaluation plans for Think Surgical products in collaboration with SW/HW engineers, clinical trainers, and product managers.

    o Strategize, design and execute usability studies at various stages of product development from early prototypes through formative and summative evaluations.

    o Author usability study protocols and reports, moderate studies, and analyze study data.

    o Manage and drive company SOP’s /policies/ procedure for alignment with UX design guidelines

    o Reinforce a user-centered design approach across the organization.

    • Synthesize and manage the collection of detailed use information of robotic products through various techniques including contextual inquiry, DITL analysis, heuristic analysis, PCA analysis, observation at hospitals, and personas in collaboration with SW/HW engineers, clinical trainers, and product managers.
    • Provide training / information sessions as needed for the company to keep abreast of regulations and best practices for medical device human factors (e.g. IEC 62366, AAMI HE75, ISO 14971, and the latest FDA guidance on applying human factors engineering)
    • Manage usability engineering activities and establish this role as the subject matter expert for the corporation. Participate on project teams in the development projects and provide schedules and status to product managers and engineering project managers.
    • Provide guidance to development teams to ensure proper UX design factors are considered and incorporated into product designs to ensure the clinical safety and efficacy of the product.
    • Work closely with engineers and developers to review, assess, and contribute to UI designs during their development by providing guidance, ideas, and feedback and characterizing surgical performance of prototypes.
    • Design wire-frames, storyboards, user flows, process flows, and interactive prototypes to effectively communicate and evaluate user-centered design ideas.
    • Identify potential product enhancements & new product ideas by applying an analytical approach to understanding the clinical needs of surgeons.
    • Other duties or MDD projects as required to meet company’s objectives.

    Basic qualifications:

    · BA/BS degree in Biomedical Engineering, Design, HCI, HFE or related field, or equivalent practical experience.

    · 2-5 years of HFE and medical device development experience.

    · Ability to lead usability engineering activities (i.e. establishing usability requirements; creating usability risk analyses, study protocols, and study reports) for a complex, software-controlled electro-mechanical medical device.

    · Ability to apply user-centered design and usability engineering principles to product research, development, and design.

    · Ability to collaborate with and across various groups and levels of management within the organization, including other engineering groups, marketing, clinical applications, and regulatory.

    · Experienced with all phases of the product development life cycle including feasibility, planning, requirements, design and development, V&V, and design transfer.

    · Understands general aspects of manufacturing and prototyping.

    · Knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office Suite

    · Familiar with US/EU guidance and standards related to human factors/usability, design controls and risk management and GMP.

    · Excellent organizational skills along with strong attention to detail

    · Strong communication skills for collaborating with cross-functional teams.

    · Ability to work both independently and with a team in a collaborative setting

    Preferred Qualifications:

    Experience working with clinicians, labs or hospital settings.

    Experience/background in medical devices, orthopedics, and/or robotics.

    Thorough knowledge of FDA Quality System Regulation, ISO 13485 (Quality System) requirements, ISO 14971 (Risk Management) requirements, and Medical Device Directives (MDD) requirements, IEC 62304 Medical Device Software – Software Lifecycle Processes, General Principles of Software Validation – FDA Guidance, and IEC 62366 Medical Devices – Application of Usability.

    Applied experience and thorough understanding of:

    FDA medical device regulations, guidance, and import/exports requirements.

    Medical device labeling and promotional requirements

    Medical device quality systems

    Product development processes

    Engineer #1 (Javascript)
    Company Name Exabyte.io Company Location San Francisco, California
    Job Link

    Job description

    This is a unique opportunity for an energetic senior-level professional to join our founding team. Top-notch skills in javascript, as well as solid knowledge of distributed web applications are required.

    We are looking for an exceptional software engineer, able to scale our efforts in building a cloud-native environment for computational materials design. Successful candidates will start from design/implementation and further take on a leadership role to grow together.

    We will screen for the following:

    - activity in the open domains: eg. github commits, npm packages, stackoverflow

    - educational and professional background: top universities, industry leaders

    - years of experience with Javascript, Node.js, Meteor, React.js

    More details follow.

    ---

    # WHY JOIN:

    - apply your vision to a new and highly innovative vertical

    - define the product and user experience for generations to come

    - top enterprise customers from semiconductor, clean energy, chemical, aero/auto etc.

    # RESPONSIBILITIES:

    - design and implement a cloud-native distributed web application

    - plan and develop new features in javascript/Meteor.js/Node.js/React.js

    # REQUIREMENTS:

    - proven ability to understand complex scientific concepts (eg. tensors, crystal symmetry)

    - 5 or more years of experience with javascript

    - solid knowledge of mongodb

    - familiarity with python

    - prior experience with rabbitmq/celery

    - solid knowlede of git/github/unix

    - extreme attention to details

    # STACK:

    - javascript: Meteor.js/Node.js/React.js

    - rabbitmq/celery

    - mongodb

    - git

    # PLUS:

    - prior background in enterprise software, materials science, chemistry, physics or related

    # PERKS:

    - 1-3% equity

    - $90-150k salary

    - unlimited vacation days

    - unlimited remote work days

    - flexible hours

    - equipment of your choice

    ----

    Senior Sales Engineer
    Company Name Lacework | Security Redefined for the Cloud Company Location San Francisco Bay Area
    Job Link

    Job description

    Senior Sales Engineer

    San Francisco Bay Area

    Full-time

    Lacework was founded to keep critical data and applications safe as organizations increasingly migrate workloads to the public cloud. Where traditional security tools and manual log analysis fail in these environments, Lacework gives security teams the automation, speed, and scale to protect cloud workloads at the pace of DevOps. Lacework Polygraph, our flagship product, monitors workloads, applications, processes, containers, machines, users and accounts to automatically surface anomalous behaviors out of billions of events per hour. Lacework provides unprecedented visibility, automates breach detection, delivers one-click investigation, and simplifies cloud compliance. Based in Mountain View CA, Lacework is funded by Sutter Hill Ventures.

    The Sales Engineer (SE) is a critical function of the Lacework sales team. In this position, you'll work closely with our sales reps and play a key role in winning deals and driving the business forward. You'll be a trusted technical advisor to a wide range of customers from startups to Fortune 500 enterprises within a specified region. The role requires excellent technical, communication, and organizational skills, and previous experience in cloud platform, infrastructure products, and security architectures. You will help prospective customers and partners understand the benefits of Lacework, explaining technical features and problem-solving any potential roadblocks.

    Role Responsibilities:

    • Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities, identify key customer technical objections and develop the strategy to resolve technical blockers.

    • Own the technical relationship with Lacework’s customers, including managing product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of additional technical resources.

    • Deliver demos to customers and work hands-on with customers to demonstrate Lacework’s value in customer/partner environments.

    • Recommend security best practices, cloud architecture, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete cloud security solution based on Lacework.

    • Bring constructive feedback from customers to product management to improve the Lacework solution. Contribute to PRDs.

    • Train sales team members on technical aspects of the Lacework product as needed.

    • Expect moderate travel.

    Minimum Qualifications:

    • BA/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.

    • Experience serving in the capacity of a technical sales engineer in a cloud computing environment or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role (including working as a member of a professional services or systems engineering team).

    • Experience with AWS, Azure, private clouds, VMs, and containerized application architecture. Experience in and understanding of cloud deployments - especially as it relates to security and compliance requirements.

    • Experience presenting and delivering technical pitches to CISOs, architects, and technical staff.

    Preferred Qualifications:

    • Master's degree in Computer Science, or other technical field.

    • AWS Certified Solutions Architect

    • Experience in and understanding of cloud deployments - especially as it relates to security and compliance requirements.

    • Experience architecting and developing software or infrastructure for scalable, distributed systems.

    • Ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies and solutions in the cloud/IT technology space.

    • Previous DevOps/DevSecOps experience

    At Lacework, we believe in promoting from within and with our current growth plans and acceleration in our business, strong performance in this SE role can lead to upward mobility within the sales organization.



    UC Engineer
    Company Name Rakuten USA Company Location San Mateo, California
    Job Link

    Job description

    Rakuten, Inc. is the largest e-commerce company in Japan, and third largest e-commerce marketplace worldwide. We seek to empower merchants to deliver Omotenashi, a hospitality mindset, which helps sellers create lasting relationships with customers. Along with the global marketplaces, Rakuten supports an ever-expanding list of acquisitions and strategic investments in disruptive industries and growing markets.

    At Rakuten, we offer competitive salaries, benefits, annual bonuses, a stocked kitchen and a dynamic office environment. We love investing in our people and when it comes down to it, we think our entire team is pretty awesome. As a technology-focused company, we understand the importance of an energizing atmosphere that promotes collaboration and innovation.

    We are seeking a UC Engineer to join our team! As a member of both an agile local IT team and a globally distributed UC team, you will design, install and operate a global Cisco Unified Communications catalog for thousands of users including VIPs in the Americas and beyond. Major project work will center on migrating existing offices from legacy Avaya infrastructure and will involve requirements gathering, design, and consulting with end users, office managers, and local IT staff. You will also provide the Global UC team with tier three remote and onsite fault troubleshooting. You will need to be flexible to work in a global UC team by occasionally working outside of normal office hours and occasionally traveling to regional and international offices. Essential duties and requirements may include, but are not limited to:

    • Ensure Rakuten’s global UC platform provides a high quality and high availability service for tens of thousands end users
    • Design and implement our global UC SIP network in accordance with Cisco’s Collaboration Architecture Solution Reference Network Design (SRND)
    • Willingness and enthusiasm to support a weekly regional all-hands meeting which takes place over WebEx CMR (hardware, software, and overseeing successful production of the event)
    • Finding innovative voice migration solutions to PMI (Post-Merger Integration) companies
    • Designing and deploying UC and audio/visual solutions for new office build outs as Rakuten expands and refreshes offices in the US
    • Troubleshooting issues on-site and remotely
    • Training partner staff and overseas IT teams in providing first level support
    • Willingness to work within and complete projects within Rakuten’s highly specific security framework
    • Ownership UC hardware, software, and cloud-based UC systems, including procurement and maintenance contract renewals
    • Researching proactive upgrades and fully testing in our lab before releasing to production
    • Producing high-quality documentation for both end user and internal use, and ensuring that it is continuously up to date

    Qualifications:

    • 3-5 years of experience in Cisco Unified Communication design and engineering (including but not limited to: ongoing management, upgrades, and migrations)
    • Extensive experience in design, implementation, and hands-on support of a large multi-site, multi-CUCM, TMS, and VCS platform
    • Expert in conference room UC design and best practices, and working with third-parties on build/implementation
    • Experience working with a globally distributed team across the gamut of time zones
    • Strong initiative, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills
    • Willingness to work in a demanding, dynamic, ever-changing environment
    • Willingness to work with various other engineering teams collaboratively and proactively

    Preferred Qualifications:

    • Cisco CCNP Collaboration or CCVP or equivalent experience
    • Advanced networking skills and directing were needed your routing/switching/security requests to the Network Team
    • Expertise in: multi-site CUCM, Unity, VCS, SME, ISDN, SIP, Cisco VG series, and Border Element
    • Advanced knowledge of WebEx's licensing model, including Cloud Connected Audio (CCA) and Collaboration Meeting Room (CMR)
    • Complete understanding Cisco’s UC licensing
    • Understanding of Cisco new cloud collaboration platform will be added advantage

    Responsibilities

    BBVA is a global financial group with more than 135,000 employees and 67 million customers across 35 countries. BBVA is on a mission to be the world's #1 digital bank. BBVA is building the foremost digital banking franchise worldwide.

    BBVA’s New Digital Businesses (NDB) is a global business unit that is disrupting the banking and financial services industry by investing in, partnering with, incubating, and acquiring fintech start-ups. With offices in Madrid, San Francisco, Hong Kong and London, NDB is a key piece of BBVA’s global innovation initiative. Through NDB, BBVA has acquired Simple (US), Holvi (Finland), and Openpay (Mexico). It owns a substantial stake in Atom (UK). It invests in fintechs like Prosper, Personal Capital, and Coinbase through its venture capital arm, Propel Venture Partners. And it is incubating a number of cutting-edge fintech start-ups including a bank-as-a-service platform that will allow developers to access the bank’s core processes via open APIs.

    One of those new fintech start-ups is Denizen Financial Inc. incubated within the bank’s portfolio of technology startups, and on a mission to make consumer banking borderless. Recently launched into market, we are building teams in San Francisco and Madrid, Spain and we are looking for a Senior DevOPs Engineer to join us.

    What will you be doing?

    • An experienced, committed engineer who enjoys building clean and reliable infrastructure and maintaining a high level of service
    • A pragmatist, with solid technical judgment and the ability to account for business priorities when making technical tradeoffs and risk assessments
    • Someone who has handled major production incidents and will not panic, who can support the team as they face new problems
    • “Infrastructure as code” mindset
    • Develop and maintain infrastructure for development and production operations
    • Participate in on-call rotation, responding to production incidents and resolving them
    • Support developers in creating, maintaining and using internal tools and services

    Required

    • Strong experience with cloud infrastructure technologies and tools, especially AWS, Docker, and Kubernetes
    • Strong experience with Linux system administration, including configuration management tools such as Chef, Puppet, Ansible
    • Experience developing orchestration tools in at least one language, such as Python or Go
    • Experience with queueing systems such as RabbitMQ
    • Experience with database administration, especially MongoDB and clustered configurations
    Desirable:

    • Terraform
    • Javascript/Node.JS

    Senior Network Support Engineer
    Company Name Terralogic Inc. Company Location Santa Clara, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Excellent opportunity for individual seeking to join as Senior Network Support Engineer to support our client based out of Santa Clara. We are looking for passionate, tech-savvy and empathetic problem solvers to join our support team. This customer-facing role will expose you to a diverse group of customers, partners and internal teams providing opportunities for career growth in a fun, challenging, and fast-paced environment.

    Responsibilities

    • Receive technically complex customer issues and maintain ownership of issue and customer communication until resolved completely.
    • Solve highly complex problems involving in-depth product knowledge
    • Interact with DevOps as needed to resolve complex customer issues.
    • Act as technical lead, mentor, and role model on a team of engineers; provide direction to others, review solutions and articles, etc. Mentor new Support Engineers.
    • Develop and deliver technical training to other engineers.
    • Maintain strong working knowledge of pre-release products and take ownership for product improvement in key product areas.
    • Build support lab environment to reproduce, analyze and test customer issues and fixes in real-time
    • Report software bugs and customer suggestions.
    • Write complex technical articles, sample scripts and diagnostic rules to improve engineer and customer product knowledge and supportability.
    • Assist with selection of new team members.
    • Monitor alerts/alarms raised by monitoring tools for customer deployment; do the initial diagnosis and create tickets as done for customer-reported issues
    • Participate in on-call rotation after business hours (weekday / weekend)
    • Work on normal priority issues and participate in customer onboarding activities as we build the team

    Qualifications

    • Bachelor’s in Computer Science / Engineering
    • 4-7 years relevant experience in Support, Devops, QA or Professional Services
    • Prior experience as network support engineer handling US customers
    • Strong experience in supporting complex, enterprise networking products and networking operating systems esp. Linux.
    • Solid hands-on working knowledge must include a combination of:
    • Networking - Firewalls, Routing/Switching/VLANs, Proxies/ Load Balancers, TCP/IP, WAN & LAN Protocols, DHCP, DNS
    • Linux
    • Read and analyze network traces
    • Virtualization and containers - VMware, Hyper-V, Docker, OpenStack
    • Cloud knowledge - AWS, Azure
    • Logging systems - Logstash, Elasticsearch, Kibana
    • Scripting with Python
    • Extensive experience in creating lab environment and writing complex technical articles
    • Strong customer service, accurate and logical problem solving, communication skills, and the ability to work under pressure
    • Strong ability to work in a team environment and interact with cross-functional groups
    • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
    • Networking certifications CCNP or JNCIP and QA experience a plus
    • Programming and debugging skills a plus

    The very basic foundation of Terralogic has been to provide Technology Services for the Connected World. Our core DNA is in tying deep Engineering expertise to our Customers road map and business needs to bring true partnership! We work from product conceptualization, to product maturity, decline & sustenance by investing in a broad range of technical skills and domain experts with an eye on stability and increased productivity. We look at problem statements exactly the way our customers look at them and provide far reaching solutions at highly optimized cost levels. With a thousand plus strength, experienced management and best-in-class practices, we deliver world-class successes for our Customers!

    Fullstack Engineer
    Company Name PresenceLearning Company Location San Francisco, California
    Job Link

    Job description

    Talent is an overused word, but rightly so—people drive success. But talent isn’t enough. To prosper at PresenceLearning, you must embrace our fundamental pursuit: improving the lives of students with special needs. Every action we take, every meeting we attend, and every product we release drives toward positive human impact. If this mission inspires you, consider joining our team!

    Why is this role important?

    PresenceLearning’s mission is to help children unlock their full potential by democratizing access to high quality therapy. We believe that people deserve a better experience when using healthcare systems, no matter what their role. We are looking for a smart, collaborative, inquisitive Frontend Engineer who is seeking an opportunity to delight the user in the often-overlooked segment of healthcare.

    What will you do at PresenceLearning?

    • Own Frontend Development in a best-in-class telehealth marketplace that connects patients to providers
    • Work closely with Designers and Product Managers to build delightful, responsive features for all types of users on the platform.
    • Improve the usability of critical internal systems, such as clinician scheduling, invoicing, and patient management; even minor improvements in these systems have a profound impact on efficiency, effectiveness, and satisfaction
    • Implement an interface to help clinicians record sessions that parents can play back to see how their children are progressing
    • Develop innovative therapy activities that helps nonverbal patients with autism potentially say their first words
    • Build a delightful electronic medical record frontend that vastly improves the traditional experience of bloated, heavy, unusable, EMR systems
    • Evaluate frontend frameworks, and decide which is best for a particular project

    What are we looking for?

    • B.S. or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience
    • 5+ years of deep expertise in Javascript
    • Expertise building rich frontend experiences with modern tools: our frontend toolkit is Angular, Less, and Grunt, so familiarity or a desire to learn are a must
    • Full command of HTML, CSS, JavaScript
    • Experience with Node for testing JavaScript
    • Significant understanding of object-oriented programming, data structures, algorithms, design patterns, systems engineering, scalability, databases, code optimization, unit testing, debugging, continuous delivery, and version control
    • Strong experience with modern browsers and debuggers
    • Experience shipping products
    • Some experience with native iOS development (Swift, Obj-C) and designing for mobile is a plus
    • Strong, articulate opinions on product design and UX
    • Work well autonomously, and in a cross-functional team
    • Passion for bringing the team along with you and make each member more effective through mentoring, coaching, and peer review
    • A startup-person: hands-on, proactive, sees their role as more than just a job

    Where is this position located?

    This role is based in our San Francisco, CA headquarters, and reports to our VP of Engineering.



    Sr. Program Manager - Engineering
    Company Name Ellie Mae Company Location Pleasanton, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Ellie Mae (NYSE:ELLI) is a leading provider of innovative on-demand software solutions and services for the residential mortgage industry. Mortgage lenders of all sizes use Ellie Mae’s Encompass ® all-in-one mortgage management solution, Mavent Compliance Service, and AllRegs research, reference and education resources to improve compliance, loan quality and efficiency across the entire mortgage lifecycle.

    Summary Of Responsibilities

    This critical position in the Engineering Program Management organization is to drive multiple concurrent engineering and service operations programs. The ideal candidate will be someone who is customer focused, collaborative, can be the watchdog and strong program manager for the release across multiple product development teams. He/she also ensures governance around the Dev processes and practices, puts in adequate controls in place, while helping us to provide proactive outbound communication to support etc. The ultimate goal is for this person to be the proactive voice from Dev working very closely with all outbound teams effectively to improve customer satisfaction from a Dev and Operational standpoint.

    The Senior Technical Program Manager will provide cross-functional project and program management leadership to ensure the successful and predictable delivery of our Ellie Mae products.

    We are looking for a candidate to bring programmatic rigor and best practices (Agile, Scrum, PMI), to work in partnership with, and to further the capability of our team. Along with this program management discipline, we look for passion around the evolving market for cloud storage application and infrastructure services.

    Primary Responsibilities & Objectives

    • Develop and own cross functional program plans that define planning, development, verification, operations, milestones, and quality of infrastructure and application development initiatives
    • Develop, document and execute standardized product deliverable procedures to improve product/service lifecycle management practices and tools
    • Develop detailed technical understanding of all components to facilitate prioritization of requests from the Product Management organization and other key internal stakeholders as well as identify the connections and dependencies among other teams.
    • Support the Scrum teams with monitoring schedule deviations and assisting in the development of corrective action plans at the program level
    • Partner with the internal Product Management organization to drive requirements and work with other teams to continuously interact with stakeholders to set expectations, review objectives and coordinate resources across the individual projects.
    • Work with Release Management leadership to develop release schedules and intermediate milestones for the PLM.
    • Manage, track, and regularly communicate on-time delivery of multi-phased programs to different levels ranging from cross functional teams to Executives.
    • Oversee and manage large-scale infrastructure efforts while leading parallel programs for software development and service operations
    • Partner with the Engineering Release Caption to identify the program's individual technical projects and estimates the resources required to deliver the program.
    • Work closely with your team of Engineering Program Managers, the Product Management team and key Engineering teams across the company to define strategy and requirements for program health
    • Responsible for managing successful delivery of program releases into production on agreed schedules.

    Basic Qualifications, Skills And Education

    • 10+ years of overall program management experience, with 5+ years in Project Management and Program Management capacity for Enterprise Software companies
    • Strong collaboration, project planning skills
    • Excellent judgment, decision making skills, and the ability to work under continual deadline pressure
    • Excellent written and oral communications
    • Strong, independent leader, who is a self-starter and a proven team player in a high achievement-oriented environment
    • CSM required, PMP certification a plus
    • Bachelor's or Master’s degree in technical field, MBA a plus

    Ellie Mae is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities, Females, Disabled and Veterans are encouraged to apply.

    We do not accept resumes from headhunters, placement agencies, or other suppliers that have not signed a formal agreement with us.


    Backend Engineer
    Company Name Grand Rounds, Inc. Company Location San Francisco, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Grand Rounds’ vision is to create a path to great health and health care, for everyone, everywhere. Founded in 2011, the company provides an employer-based platform that delivers improved outcomes for patients and their families. It does this through an end-to-end solution that connects patients with medical care informed by the latest and best practices—correcting misdiagnoses and preventing unnecessary or failed treatments. Named second among Glassdoor’s 2016 Best Places to Work, Grand Rounds helps restore individual health and quality of life, and offers employers lower health care spend and higher employee productivity.

    The Role

    Grand Rounds provides a data-driven platform that delivers improved clinical outcomes for patients while reducing care delivery inefficiencies. To enable better outcomes, we rely on billions of data points on patients and their medical care. Consuming, correlating and securing heterogeneous healthcare datasets, and in turn unlocking its value through real-time analytics is a daunting, yet rewarding task. We’re excited to continue building our systems and infrastructure into a world-class platform for patient care.

    Grand Rounds is looking for enthusiastic and passionate engineers to join the Data Engineering team. In this role, you will work closely with your Data Engineering team members, along with the Data Science team, to build data products used by direct internal and external consumers. Our goal is to pull the healthcare industry into the 21st century by using data to revolutionize care and improve patient outcomes. We love engineers who can be characterized as bright, enthusiastic, and hungry to learn. If that describes yourself, come join Grand Rounds!

    Components You May Work On

    • Privacy protection in cloud-based data stores
    • High throughput data delivery pipelines
    • Data integration platform
    • High performance, low latency patient/healthcare-provider search tool
    • Warehousing and reports system

    Qualifications

    • 2+ years of relevant experience
    • Experience with our current technologies: Ruby, Rails, Python, AWS, Kinesis/Kafka, MySQL/PostgreSQL
    • Have worked with large and complex data systems
    • Understand datastores, networking, distributed systems, and architectural patterns
    • Familiar with modeling real-world data in both RDBMS and NoSQL persistence layers
    • Passion towards utilizing technology to disrupt the healthcare industry
    • Enjoys working on a collaborative and fast-paced team

    Grand Rounds is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law. Grand Rounds considers all qualified applicants in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.


    GPU Engineer, Autonomous Driving
    Company Name SAIC Innovation Center Company Location San Jose, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    SAIC Motors is the largest car manufacturer in China selling more than 6 million cars annually. SAIC USA is a fully owned subsidiary that engages in research and development for cutting edge technologies such as autonomous driving and Human Computer Interfaces. We have multiple openings at our recently set up Innovation Center in San Jose, CA in the Autonomous Driving team.

    As a GPU Engineer, you will develop prototype embedded systems for self-driving cars, and optimize our existing autonomous driving system for lower end GPU architectures. You will work with Scientist and Engineers at SAIC Innovation Center, taking their CUDA based Deep Learning code currently running on high end machines. Your optimized GPU accelerated software will run on platforms such as Nvidia TX2 and PX2. You will also advise software engineers about approaches that will facilitate simpler transition to embedded GPU-based systems.

    Requirements

    • MS/PhD in computer science, electrical engineering, aerospace engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience
    • 5+ years of experience in software development using C/C++. Candidates with significantly more experience are also encouraged to apply.
    • Experience putting safety-critical code on cars or code optimization for GPUs/embedded platforms.
    • Experience with ARM Cortex, X86 with RTOS, or GPU (CUDA) programming
    • Familiarity with RTOS (real-time operating systems)
    • Experience with real-time constraints, and hardware interfaces (e.g. Ethernet, UART, SPI, I2C)

    Preferred Qualifications

    Prior embedded software experience at an automotive company working on ADAS products or autonomous vehicle prototype

    System Integration and in-vehicle debugging

    Deep Learning

    Experience with processing sensor data at different sensor rates including cameras, lidar, IMU and GPS

    Fundamentals in linear algebra, and probabilistic techniques

    ROS / Linux experience

    Inquisitive, proactive, and interested in learning new tools and techniques

    These roles will challenge the boundaries of your problem-solving, and will be rewarding as your prototype creations are transitioned and deployed in real-world environments. When you join the SAIC team, you will discover all the benefits, rewards and development opportunities you’d expect from a diverse global leader. You’ll become part of a fast paced team that is pushing the boundaries of technologies and customer experience.

    Benefits

    Competitive Salary, Medical Benefits, FSA, 401K, Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance.


    R-D Engineer
    Company Name Real Staffing Company Location Sonoma, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Job Title: R-D Engineer

    Location: Santa Rosa, CA 95403

    Description

    Highly likely to extend this is an entry level position. We will look at folks just graduating with degree in Biomedical Engineer, Mechanical Engineer, etc. Experience w/ Solidworks or equivalent would be a plus. Need people that are ready to learn and work hard. R/D Engineer Position Description: Contribute to product development by designing, developing, and implementing test methods and equipment to conduct tests on materials, components, and devices to meet development and regulatory requirements. Works under the general supervision of a more experienced engineer or engineering manager. Responsibilities: Provide solutions to a variety of technical problems of moderate scope and complexity.

    • Contribute to design of new aortic stent graft concepts utilizing systematic engineering methods, physical/computational modeling, and data analysis.
    • Develop verification and validation testing, and perform analysis to evaluate designs for short and long term performance and reliability.
    • Develop and design test fixtures, measurement techniques, and equipment consistent with Draft standards and in accordance with ASTM and FDA requirements.
    • Design, develop, and implement cost-effective methods of testing and troubleshooting systems and equipment.
    • Compile and analyze data and define changes required in testing equipment, testing procedures or new testing requirements.
    • Maintain technical knowledge current with advancing technology related to aortic stent grafts and associated accessories by engaging in continuing education programs in selected disciplines and in new fields of engineering and/or project management.
    • Work under general supervision. Follow established procedures. Contribute to the completion of milestones associated with specific projects.
    • Organize, prepare and present technical information material in a clear, effective, and skillful manner to immediate management, project leaders, and other professionals using high-quality drawings and prototypes.
    • Interact professionally with immediate supervisor, project leaders, and other professionals in the section or group. Occasionally interact with inter-organizational contacts. Comply with applicable corporate and departmental policies.
    • Proactively manage deliverables and provide regular updates to professional staff, project, and functional management.
    • Perform required training and certifications to demonstrate compliance with applicable divisional and corporate policies in accordance with individual training matrix.

    Basic Qualifications: IN ORDER TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION, THE FOLLOWING BASIC QUALIFICATIONS MUST BE EVIDENT ON YOUR RESUME Education Required

    • A.S. / B.S. (or making progress towards) relevant engineering field, preferably Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, or Materials Science, with 2+years of experience in either implantable medical devices or materials testing and characterization. Desired Qualifications:
    • Knowledge of human anatomy and physiology.
    • Knowledge and experience in engineering mechanics, mechanical design, and structure and properties of materials.
    • Experience with CAD software such as SolidWorks.
    • Hands on experience with laboratory testing methods and fluid flow measurements.
    • A team player who can work effectively and proactively on cross-functional teams.
    • PC experience (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, MS Project, etc.).
    • Familiar with basic lab equipment.
    • A good communicator and fluent in English, both in writing and speaking. Physical Requirements: The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee:
    • is regularly required to be independently mobile
    • is required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers
    • may need to sit at a computer terminal for extended periods of time
    • must occasionally lift and move up to 30 lbs
    • may be required to travel (domestic and international), up to 10% of the time
    • may be required to use a microscope, and perform fine close work up to 8 hours/day may be required to wear eye protection to accommodate laser use

    Sthree US is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

    Senior Supplier Engineer
    Company Name Intuitive Surgical Company Location Sunnyvale, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Description

    Company Description:

    Who is Intuitive Surgical? The numbers tell an amazing story. Learn more about our company.

    Joining Intuitive Surgical means joining a team dedicated to using technology to benefit patients by improving surgical efficacy and decreasing surgical invasiveness, with patient safety as our highest priority.

    Primary Function Of Position

    Responsible for ensuring suppliers meet ISI requirements for cost, quality, delivery and service. Drive suppliers to continuously improve business and manufacturing processes. Evaluate and select suppliers. Guide Engineering in choosing suppliers for new products and provide DFM input to new designs. Monitor supplier performance.

    Roles And Responsibilities

    This position has responsibility and authority to:

    • Select and evaluate suppliers by leading efforts to find new suppliers in an existing or new commodity.
    • Conduct on-site supplier assessments as well as QMS audits and address the non-conformities.
    • Work with suppliers and ISI engineering for the new product introduction to

      • Complete part production qualification process ( PPQP), which includes but not limited to delivering on the following deliverables: spFMEA, Special Process Validations, Process capability, MSA, capacity analysis ,and FAIR .
      • Develop supplier ramp readiness based on forecast, supplier capacity, quality performance, and process capability.
      • Perform DFM by engaging suppliers early in development cycle to feedback manufacturability improvements in the designs prior to production
    • Lead and resolve the supply continuity/ quality issues at suppliers through in depth root cause and corrective actions utilizing SCARs, SCRs (Supplier Change requests) processes.
    • Monitor supplier performance and initiate improvement activities.
    • Drive suppliers to continually improve their business and manufacturing process performance to meet Intuitive Surgical’s requirements for supplier excellence including ship to stock programs using a collection of best practices in project management, Six Sigma, Lean, SPC and negotiation by leading these efforts without managerial guidance at several suppliers simultaneously.
    • Develop and use metrics for supplier part cost, delivery, quality, capacity and capability by creating metrics to measure real improvement and judge required intervention or change at the supplier or in a commodity.
    • Driving change to ISI specifications as necessary by understanding and changing specifications and drawings including driving the ECO process to implementation.
    • Prepare and deliver supplier communications as required by independently working with suppliers on scorecard creation of QBRs, Supplier Summits, etc.
    • Identify and investigate opportunities for cost reduction and/or quality improvement by judging opportunities and creating strategies to seize those opportunities, completes research and provides data-driven plans to management.

    Qualifications

    Skill/Job Requirements:

    In order to adequately perform the responsibilities of this position the individual must possess:

    • BS degree in Engineering or equivalent, Masters degree preferred
    • Minimum 10 years related experience in Supplier Quality and/or Supplier Development or related field
    • Excellent knowledge of 21 CFR part 820 and ISO 13485 (experience in auditing suppliers to these standards): Certified Lead auditor preferred, but not required
    • Demonstrable knowledge of a wide range of manufacturing processes including understanding of key input variables for quality, cost and capacity (specialization can be in metal fabrication, plastics, or contract manufacturing)
    • Practical knowledge of pfmeas and process validations
    • Ability to read and interpret detailed mechanical drawings and communicate technical information
    • Excellent problem solving and project management skills
    • Excellent written and verbal communication skills including presentations to executive level management
    • A proven history of implementing Lean/6 Sigma/SPC Programs at suppliers
    • Practical knowledge of part production qualification process
    • Significant computer experience using Windows, Word, Excel, Access and ERP Information Systems, preferably SAP
    • CAD experience with 3D modeling tools is a plus
    • Proven ability to motivate suppliers
    • Experience in a high-volume medical device company is a plus
    • Ability to travel to suppliers on an as needed basis – domestic and international

    We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer.

    171808



    Engineer III
    Company Name Bio-Rad Laboratories Company Location Hercules, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Overview

    What you'll be doing:

    • Create working detail/ 3D layouts drawings.
    • Perform cooling and heating load calculations.
    • Prepare one-line diagrams for supply air, exhaust air, return air, chilled water, heating hot water, office zones, laboratory, zones, etc. with limited input from senior staff.
    • Prepare floor plans showing mechanical/Electrical and piping, plumbing.
    • Prepare Electrical/Mechcanica drawings, able to build machines from layouts.
    • Perform verification/validations and take-offs of existing systems for renovation projects.
    • Coordinate and communicate with other disciplines (Design Engineers, Process Engineers/Engineering, etc.)
    • Maintain engineering project(s) and conducts engineering project meetings.
    • Work with senior engineers, Program Managers and clients to meet scheduled milestones on multiple projects.
    • Work with vendors on new product quotes and scheduling of product being manufactured.

    What You Need For This Role

    • BSME with 5 plus years of Design and/or Manufacturing Enginnering experience.
    • Excellent communication, problem solving and analytical skills are required.
    • Strong organizational skills and ability to multi-task in support of multiple projects is essential.
    • Understands work planning and scheduling to manage design process to the available hours in the work plan.
    • Experience with SolidWorks 16 & 17 and AutoCAD.
    • SAP experience required.

    What’s In It For You

    • Competitive pay and great benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401k and more.
    • Opportunities for growth and training.
    • Stability of a profitable 60+ year old company.
    • Great work environment.

    About Bio-Rad

    Bio-Rad is a global leader providing a broad array of clinical diagnostics and life science research products. With a team of more than 7,800 employees and a global network of operations serving our customers, we help people live longer, healthier lives.

    Bio-Rad was founded over six decades ago and has continued to provide the healthcare industry with innovative and useful products that help life science researchers accelerate the discovery process and medical diagnostic labs obtain faster, better results.

    EEO/AA Employer/Veterans/Disabled/Race/Ethnicity/Gender/Age

    API Engineer
    Company Name Snagajob Company Location Oakland, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Overview

    Snagajob, America’s #1 spot for hourly work, is the only company solely committed to providing recruitment and hiring solutions to the hourly industry. With over 65 million registered job seekers and a leading hourly-focused talent management system, Snagajob has been serving hourly workers and those who employ them since 2000.

    With offices in Richmond, VA, and the Washington, D.C., metro area, Snagajob has been named to Fortune Magazine’s Great Place to Work® list for each of the past eight years.

    Snagajob is seeking an experienced and team-oriented API Engineer to develop the technology that powers one of the largest and fastest growing hiring platforms in the country. The right candidate is energetic, self-motivated, and enjoys being a key contributor in an entrepreneurial environment. Proven track record of success and a passion for delivering high-quality and large scale applications is crucial.

    What We Believe

    • We believe that what we do is a craft and that making great software is a collaboration of art and science.
    • We believe that business goals are met most efficiently when they are aligned with top flight technical execution.
    • We believe in continually examining our practices in architecture, testing, development, deployment and support.
    • We believe in a strong culture where working hard and having fun go hand in hand.

    What You'll Bring

    • Collaborate with team and Product to generate and fully define innovative new product features that serve millions of users.
    • Provide accurate scoping and estimation of development efforts based on product requirements and a solid grasp of the relevant technologies.
    • Work both independently and in a team environment to design, implement, and test highly available and highly performing functionalities to a heavily trafficked web site.
    • Lead the charge in maintaining and scaling our underlying technical infrastructure.
    • Collaborate with and mentor other team members.
    • Degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
    • 5+ years experience developing large scale and multi-tiered web applications. Experience developing and supporting a multi-tenant SaaS product strongly preferred.
    • 5+ years hands-on experiences in object oriented development using ASP.NET, C# and related software development tools.
    • Excellent knowledge of REST APIs and related technologies, e.g. HTTP, REST, JSON, and XML. Experience with Microservices or Web API a plus.
    • Fluent in database entity design using NoSQL, especially MongoDB. Experience with schema design and SQL using Microsoft SQL Server and Entity Framework a plus.
    • Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, with strong interest in tackling diverse technical problems.
    • Thorough understanding of Agile practices, and ability to adjust in a fast-paced environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

    What You Get To Do

    • Share ownership of a platform with a highly collaborative development team.
    • Work on a suite of products to help connect workers and employers.
    • Explore new technologies and frameworks to drive our architecture forward.
    • Focus on engineering craftsmanship and best practices.
    • Teach, mentor and learn with the team.

    What You Can Expect From Snagajob

    Snagajob offers a highly competitive compensation and benefits package including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, 401k plan, health and fitness incentives, 20 days of PTO to start and 2 days of paid community service time, eligibility for performance-based bonuses, and casual fun work environment with an award winning culture. Snagajob is an equal opportunity employer.

    About Snagajob

    With more than 80 million registered hourly workers and 300,000 employer locations, Snagajob is America’s #1 hourly marketplace. We focus on creating instant and quality connections so workers can get jobs and employers can hire workers—in minutes. Since 2000, our mission has been to put people in right fit-positions so they can maximize their potential and live more fulfilling lives. We do this through the Snagajob marketplace and PeopleMatter, our end-to-end platform of talent and workforce management solutions. Our mobile sourcing, hiring, training, scheduling, and performance management tools drive results for single-location operators to Fortune 500 businesses with thousands of locations, across the restaurant, retail, hospitality and healthcare industries.

    With offices in Arlington, VA; Richmond, VA; Charleston, SC and Oakland, CA, Snagajob was named to Fortune Magazine's Great Place to Work® list for eight years in a row and Washington Magazine's 50 Great Places to Work list for 2015.


    Software Engineer - DevOps
    Company Name Twitch Company Location San Francisco, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    The Science Engineering team is looking for a DevOps Engineer to help us build usable, scalable, and reliable systems. Our team develops and operates the real-time behavioral data pipeline, which collects, processes, and distributes data to other teams. You would make every step of the software lifecycle faster through better tools, processes, and abstractions, and build tools to manage distributed infrastructure running on Spark and Hadoop. Our systems power decision making throughout the company through hundreds of end users, and we have a constantly growing list of systems that consume our data.

    Responsibilities

    • Learn, extend, and maintain Science Engineering’s build, deploy, config, metrics, and alerting systems
    • Work with other engineers to determine tool requirements, then drive the implementation, documentation, maintenance, and improvement of these tools
    • Review current tools to identify deficiencies
    • Keep up with tool ecosystems, both internal and external, and integrate the best into science engineering
    • Develop and communicate a clear vision of how products should function
    • Participate in creating standard frameworks and libraries for internal tools

    Requirements

    • 2+ years experience in software development
    • Background in Linux/Unix Automation and Administration
    • Experience with containerization like Docker and lxc
    • Experience with automation/configuration management using either Ansible, Puppet, Chef or an equivalent
    • Excellent command of at least one programming language
    • Excellent communicator and team player
    • A strong desire to minimize the operational overhead of systems, large and small
    • Experience orchestrating distributed systems such as Spark and Hadoop
    • Ability to learn new languages (Go, Python) and technologies quickly
    • You know how to ship code in fast, iterative cycles

    Bonus Points

    • A degree in Computer Science or equivalent academic background
    • Experience with big data and data visualization
    • Hands-on experience building services using Amazon Web Services
    • Avid user of Twitch or passion for video games

    Perks

    • Full benefits, including medical, dental, vision and life
    • 401(k) savings plan with a company match
    • Catered daily lunch and dinners (and hearty breakfasts three times a week)
    • Unlimited snacks and drinks
    • Monthly in-office massages
    • Corporate gym membership
    • Commuter benefits
    • Flexible time off policy
    • Weekly happy hours and opportunity to attend one gaming event or tournament
    • Top of the line technology to help you build your own workspace

    Twitch is the world’s leading video platform and community for gamers, with more than 100 million visitors per month. We connect gamers from around the world by allowing them to broadcast, watch, and chat with each other. Twitch’s live and on-demand video platform forms the backbone of a distribution network for video game broadcasters including pro players, tournaments, leagues, developers and gaming media organizations. Twitch is leading a revolution in gaming culture, turning gameplay into an immersive video experience. Learn more at http://twitch.tv.

    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
